greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle of coefficients of cyclotomic polynomial Phi_n(x) (exponents in decreasing order).
comment: We follow Maple in defining Phi_0 to be x; it could equally well be taken to be 1.
reference: E. R. Berlekamp, Algebraic Coding Theory, McGraw-Hill, 1968; see p. 90.
Z. I. Borevich and I. R. Shafarevich, Number Theory. Academic Press, NY, 1966, p. 325.
K. Ireland and M. Rosen, A Classical Introduction to Modern Number Theory, Springer, 1982, p. 194.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..45566, rows 0..385 flattened
example: etc. After row zero, each row n has A039649(n) terms.
mathematica: Join[{1, 0}, Table[ CoefficientList[ Cyclotomic[n, x], x] // Reverse, {n, 1, 16}] // Flatten] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 11 2012 *)
program: A013595row(n) = { if(!n, p=x, p = polcyclo(n)); Vecrev(p); }; \\ This function from _Michel Marcus_'s code for A013595.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: Example section edited by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 13 2017
